Title: Misleading Comments [core and samples]
Content:
The following misleading comments were identified:


* [This comment](https://github.com/eth-infinitism/account-abstraction/blob/9879c931ce92f0bee1bca1d1b1352eeb98b9a120/contracts/interfaces/IStakeManager.sol#L40) is incorrect now that deposits occupy 256 bits.
* [This comment](https://github.com/eth-infinitism/account-abstraction/blob/9879c931ce92f0bee1bca1d1b1352eeb98b9a120/contracts/interfaces/IPaymaster.sol#L51-L52) still refers to a second `postOp` call.
* The simulation functions both claim ([1](https://github.com/eth-infinitism/account-abstraction/blob/9879c931ce92f0bee1bca1d1b1352eeb98b9a120/contracts/interfaces/IEntryPointSimulations.sol#L38), [2](https://github.com/eth-infinitism/account-abstraction/blob/9879c931ce92f0bee1bca1d1b1352eeb98b9a120/contracts/interfaces/IEntryPointSimulations.sol#L53)) to always revert, but that is no longer accurate.
* The [paymaster validation comment](https://github.com/eth-infinitism/account-abstraction/blob/9879c931ce92f0bee1bca1d1b1352eeb98b9a120/contracts/interfaces/IPaymaster.sol#L31-L37) incorrectly implies that it can return a non-zero authorizer address.
* [This comment](https://github.com/eth-infinitism/account-abstraction/blob/9879c931ce92f0bee1bca1d1b1352eeb98b9a120/contracts/interfaces/IAggregator.sol#L23) still references the obsolete `ValidationResultWithAggregation`.
* The `BasePaymaster` [`_postOp` comment](https://github.com/eth-infinitism/account-abstraction/blob/9879c931ce92f0bee1bca1d1b1352eeb98b9a120/contracts/core/BasePaymaster.sol#L77) still references the obsolete second call.
* The [`paymasterAndData` parameter](https://github.com/eth-infinitism/account-abstraction/blob/9879c931ce92f0bee1bca1d1b1352eeb98b9a120/contracts/core/EntryPointSimulations.sol#L164) is incorrectly described as a paymaster address followed by a token address.
* The [`requiredPreFund` parameter](https://github.com/eth-infinitism/account-abstraction/blob/9879c931ce92f0bee1bca1d1b1352eeb98b9a120/contracts/samples/TokenPaymaster.sol#L116) in the `TokenPaymaster` contract is described as the amount of tokens, but it is the amount of ETH.


Consider updating them accordingly.


***Update:** Resolved in [pull request #413](https://github.com/eth-infinitism/account-abstraction/pull/413), [pull request #440](https://github.com/eth-infinitism/account-abstraction/pull/440/files).*
